programme.title: Cortesana
programme.desc: Una joven es seducida por el marido de su prima cuando la pareja llega a su casa durante una gira del pianista.

programme.title: Como dice el dicho
programme.sub-title: A la pereza persigue a la pobreza
programme.desc: Al morir su padre, una joven recibe un fideicomiso, por lo que su madre y su nuevo novio se van a vivir con ella. Cuando la joven enferma, su madre se da cuenta de que su novio es un oportunista de quien debe alejarse.

programme.title: Como dice el dicho
programme.sub-title: Chica es del diablo la capa, por un lado tapa y por el otro destapa
programme.desc: A Toño nada le importa. Su novia secuestra a Rodrigo, el hermano de Toño. Cuando las circunstancias parecen sombrías, Toño mostrará su verdadero valor.

programme.title: Como dice el dicho
programme.sub-title: Es de sabios perdonar injurias y olvidar agravios
programme.desc: Vladimir humilla a Miguel en la escuela. Él y su hermano lo amenazan con una pistola para darle una lección.

programme.title: Como dice el dicho
programme.sub-title: A buen sueño no hay cama dura
programme.desc: Sandra es apasionada del fútbol, pero su mamá quiere que se dedique al modelaje. Sandra demuestra que es capaz de cumplir su sueño.

programme.title: Como dice el dicho
programme.sub-title: Mientras más profundo es el río, menos ruido hace
programme.desc: La madre de Paty es una actriz famosa. Por la presión que ejercen sobre ella, se vuelve anoréxica y termina en el hospital.

programme.title: Como dice el dicho
programme.desc: Una joven intenta no darle importancia al problema de alcoholismo y violencia de su madre, pero termina aceptando la ayuda de sus amigas y de su novio para salvar la vida de su mamá y la relación con ella.

programme.title: Como dice el dicho
programme.sub-title: Es de héroes sonreír cuando el corazón llora
programme.desc: Javier quiere convertirse en boxeador profesional, pero su padre no lo apoya. Javier tendrá que demostrar madurez y dedicación para segur sus estudios y el deporte.

programme.title: Como dice el dicho
programme.sub-title: De lengua me como un taco
programme.desc: Kevin quiere ser rico. A escondidas, roba dinero del negocio de su padre para satisfacer a sus nuevos amigos.

programme.title: Pequeños gigantes
programme.desc: Un programa lleno de sorpresas, ya que las mamás de los participantes se unen a ellos en el escenario interpretando un popurrí. Como invitados especiales Manuel Mijares, Yuri, Aarón Díaz y un sketch cómico con Albertano, Doña Lucha y Rosa.

programme.title: Pequeños gigantes
programme.sub-title: Ha Ash, Pandora y Omar Chaparro
programme.desc: Los invitados del grupo musical Ha Ash y Pandora además de un sketch cómico con Omar Chaparro. Se estrena la sección karaoke de las estrellas con Laura G y René Franco. En Telesa, la participación especial de Sebastián Rulli.

programme.title: Pequeños gigantes
programme.sub-title: Sherlyn, Patricio Borghetti y Banda El Recodo
programme.desc: Bianca Marroquín presenta un fragmento de sus obras teatrales la Novicia Rebelde y Chicago junto a los pequeños. Sherlyn y Patricio Borghetti, se enfrentan en la prueba de karaoke de las estrellas. Finalmente un popurrí con la Banda el Recodo.

programme.title: Pequeños gigantes
programme.sub-title: María José, Julión Álvarez y Paty Cantú
programme.desc: Los cinco cantantes de la competencia estarán acompañados de grandes estrellas como Maria José, Julión Álvarez y Paty Cantú, los capitanes actuarán junto a Lety la fea, Tomás Mora y Rebeca Jones. Los Súper Poderosos son el escuadrón eliminado.

programme.title: Aquí y ahora
programme.sub-title: El hijo del Chapo: Captura y liberación de un intocable
programme.desc: El ejército mexicano despliega un operativo en Culiacán, Sinaloa, para detener a un familiar de Joaquín Guzmán Loera, 'El Chapo'. El objetivo es capturado y, durante un día, Culiacán queda atrapada en un enfrentamiento entre el ejército y los narcos.

programme.title: Aquí y ahora
programme.sub-title: Fentanilo la nueva apuesta del narco
programme.desc: México es país productor y de tránsito de Fentanilo, un opioide sintético cada vez más consumido en Estados Unidos. Esta droga causa muchas muertes entre jóvenes. Un kilo de fentanilo genera las mismas ganancias que una tonelada de cocaína.

programme.title: Aquí y ahora
programme.desc: Desesperados por encontrar una cura para la terrible enfermedad de su hija, una pareja aceptó ser parte de un experimento y arriesgarse a las consecuencias.

programme.title: Aquí y ahora
programme.desc: La muerte de la soldado Vanessa Guillén ha provocado un movimiento nacional para hablar sobre un tema incómodo, la violencia sexual contra las mujeres en las fuerzas armadas dutrante años, los abusos contra ellas han sido una epidemia sin control.

programme.title: Aquí y ahora
programme.desc: Juan Morales, cansado de estar confinado en una silla de ruedas, decidió desafiar sus límites y se convirtió en el distribuidor de drogas de su escuela. Envuelto en la violencia callejera, Juan logró salir adelante para volverse un psicólogo.

programme.title: Aquí y ahora
programme.desc: El tiempo parece moverse en cámara lenta para familiares, amigos y conocidos de personas que han sido víctimas de diferentes crímenes que, desgraciadamente, muchas veces no logran ser resueltos.

programme.title: Aquí y ahora
programme.desc: Poco a poco el ser humano termina con el planeta que habita, hoy, el plástico es uno de los mayores enemigos, no se degrada, no desaparece y ahora llena los mares, amenazando su flora y fauna sin control.

programme.title: Aquí y ahora

programme.title: Al Jarreau, Tom Canning, Peter Robinson & Ralph Humphrey
programme.sub-title: Al Jarreau - The North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festival's staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1981, American singer and Grammy Award winner Al Jarreau gave an unforgettable performance for the audience of the North Sea Jazz Festival in The Hague, the Netherlands.

programme.title: Jimmy Smith
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Chet Baker
programme.desc: This selection of unforgettable performances by some of the most iconic and influential male jazz and pop vocalists in history showcases these legends' unique essence. Delight in the expressive beauty and emotional depth of Chet Baker's rendition of “Time After Time” and “You Don't Know What Love Is", recorded live in Brussels, Belgium in 1964 and in Rome, Italy in 1956 respectively. Revel in Frank Sinatra's iconic version of “I've Got You Under My Skin". Immerse yourself in Dizzy Gillespie's dynamic performance of “Let Me Outta Here”, recorded live in Denmark in 1970. Enjoy Tony Bennett's unforgettable performance of “It Don't Mean A Thing (If It Ain't Got That Swing)” at London's majestic Royal Albert Hall in 1974. Let the haunting beauty of Nat King Cole's 1957 performance of “Autumn Leaves” and Louis Armstrong's performance of “Basin Street Blues” from 1959 delight you. Dean Martin's smooth vocal stylings will enthrall you as he performs the jazz standard “Wrap Your Troubles In Dreams". Witness the electrifying energy of Sammy Davis Jr.'s performance of “Too Close For Comfort”. Join us for this unforgettable musical experience that you'll surely cherish!

programme.title: Dee Dee Bridgewater
programme.desc: Singer Dee Dee Bridgewater walks in with considerable credentials, but this documentary related to her album ‘Red Earth' trumps them all: Red Earth is a Malian journey that merges and melts all borders. While world-beat listeners will recognize the grooves, this is Bridgewater's first time bringing her own experiences as an African-American woman back to the motherland. It results in a fusion of feeling, visions, and music.

programme.title: Raul Midón
programme.desc: Raul Midón appeared at 2017's Sing Jazz Festival in Singapore with double bassist Romeir Mendez and drummer Billy Williams. Blind since birth, Raul Midón is a singer, guitarist, and songwriter from New Mexico. With a vocal range as dynamic as his guitar playing and a remarkable talent for trumpet mimicry, Midón's performances transcend musical boundaries, effortlessly blending rock, jazz, folk, and Latin pop into his unique sound. He has worked with numerous legends, including Bill Withers, Herbie Hancock, Sting, and Dianne Reeves, and his album ‘Bad Ass and Blind' was nominated for a Grammy Award for Best Jazz Vocal Album in 2018. No wonder the Sing Jazz audience were ecstatic!

programme.title: Sarah Vaughan, Richard Davis, Ronnell Bright & Art Morgan
programme.desc: Sarah Vaughan: Live in '58 & 64 features the Divine One in her prime, wrapping her sultry voice around jazz standards such as “Lover Man”, “Misty”, and “I Got Rhythm” and popular showtunes such as “Over The Rainbow” and “Maria”. One of the greatest voices of the 20th Century, her renditions of songs by Harold Arlen, Leonard Bernstein, Johnny Burke, the Gershwins, and Stephen Sondheim are pure diva magic. These three performances demonstrate why Sarah Vaughan is invariably mentioned in the same breath as Ella Fitzgerald and Billie Holiday.

programme.title: Bill Evans
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Jazzmeia Horn
programme.desc: Vocalist Jazzmeia Horn's 2019 Malta Jazz Festival appearance was a celebration of jazz's future, infused with the soul of its past. Featuring Keith Brown (piano), Rashaan Carter (bass), Irwin Hall (flute and saxophone), and Anwar Marshall (drums), the young singer's performance was a reminder of jazz's enduring power to speak to the heart. Situated at the Valletta waterfront outside Our Lady of Liesse Church, Horn's concert was a truly spellbinding experience.

programme.title: Ahmad Jamal Trio
programme.sub-title: Ahmad Jamal Trio - North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festival's staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1989, legendary jazz pianist Ahmad Jamal brought his trio to the North Sea Jazz Festival. Accompanied by James Cammack on bass and David Bowler on drums, Jamal showcased his excellence.

programme.title: Charles Lloyd
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Robert Glasper & Jason Moran
programme.sub-title: La Gaité Lyrique: Robert Glasper & Jason Moran
programme.desc: As part of the Blue Note Jazz Festival and Blue Note Records' 75th anniversary, pianists Robert Glasper and Jason Moran delivered a stunning jazz piano duet, resulting in an exciting exploration of the great history of jazz. An intricate knowledge of African-American music is infused with modern energy. The two musicians reinterpret the stride piano tradition through captivating original songs and personal interpretations of the music of Albert Ammons, Andrew Hill, Thelonious Monk, Ornette Coleman and Herbie Hancock.

programme.title: Elena Bashkirova, Baiba Skride, Itamar Zorman & Krzysztof Chorzelski
programme.desc: During late summer every year, some of the world's best musicians meet in Israel for the Jerusalem International Chamber Music Festival (JCMF), established by pianist Elena Bashkirova and Yeheskell Beinisch. In 2016, the 19th festival was dedicated to the music of interrelated composers, such as Brahms and Schumann, and Schubert and Beethoven – performed by outstanding artists such as Sir András Schiff, Baiba Skride, Menahem Pressler and Emmanuel Pahud in the halls of the Jerusalem YMCA. This documentary film features excerpts from performances of the following works: Johannes Brahms's String Sextet no. 1, Op. 18 Franz Schubert's Arpeggione Sonata in A minor, D. 821 Antonín Dvořák's Piano Quintet no. 2 in A major, Op. 81 Ferruccio Busoni's Fantasia Contrappuntistica Felix Mendelssohn's Piano Trio no. 1, Op. 49 and Ludwig van Beethoven's Quintet for Piano and Winds, Op. 16.

programme.title: Huelgas Ensemble & Paul Van Nevel
programme.desc: Conductor Paul Van Nevel and his Huelgas Ensemble present the ideal Christmas program, consisting of an atmospheric musical selection of 14th to 19th-century compositions. The Huelgas Ensemble, which has emerged as one of Europe's premiere vocal ensembles dedicated to the performance of music from the Middle Ages and the Renaissance, is the ideal candidate for the job, conveying all the mystery and luster a Christmas celebration calls for. Van Nevel organized his varied musical selection in four distinct themes: ‘The Birth in Bethlehem', ‘The Crime of Herodes', ‘The Travel of the Three Kings', and an Epilogue. In 2015, the full program was performed and recorded at the baroque St. Augustine Church currently known as AMUZ in Antwerp, Belgium. ‘The Birth in Bethlehem' opens and closes with pieces by unidentified composers, 'Balaam de quo Vaticinans' and 'A Carol for Christmas Eve' respectively. The core of this section is made up of Jacobus Gallus's 'Myrabile Mysterium' and Jerónimo Luca's 'Este nino que es sol del Aurora'. ‘The Crime of Herodes' opens with 'Hostis Herodes Impie' by an unidentified composer, followed by Jean Mouton's 'Interrogabat Magos Herodes', Giaches De Wert's 'Vox in Rama', and Bertram Luard-Selby's 'A Voice from Ramah was There Sent'. ‘The Travel of the Three Kings Melchior, Caspar and Balthazar' opens with 'Vincti Presepio' (anonymous), followed by Pierre De Manchicourt's 'Reges Terrae', Jan Pieterszoon Sweelinck's 'Ab Oriente', and Peter Cornelius 'Drei Könige Wandern'. Lastly, the Epilogue consists of 'Quae Stella Sole Pulchrior' (anonymous) and António Marques Lésbio's 'Dexen que Ilore mi Niño'.

programme.title: Martha Argerich
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Mahler Chamber Orchestra & Barbara Hannigan
programme.sub-title: Barbara Hannigan: A Late Night Concert
programme.desc: Barbara Hannigan conducts the Mahler Chamber Orchestra in a concert recorded at the Lucerne Festival of 2014. There are pianists who also conduct, and concert masters who lead their orchestra from the violin desk, but a star soprano who coordinates an ensemble while at the same time negotiating the trickiest coloratura singing is something entirely new! This concert opens with the Overture from Rossini's La scala di seta, followed by three concert arias by Mozart: Vado, ma dove? O Dei!, K. 583, Un moto di gioia, K. 579 and Misera, dove son? K. 369. After renditions of György Ligeti's Concert Românesc and Mysteries of the Macabre, the concert closes with Fauré's Pelléas et Mélisande, Op. 80, a suite derived from incidental music.

programme.title: The Philharmonics
programme.desc: Chamber music ensemble The Philharmonics pays tribute to the music of Vienna in this March 9, 2011 concert from Vienna's Café Sperl. The ensemble, which consists of musicians from the Vienna Philharmonic and the Berlin Philharmonic, performs arrangements of five popular waltzes by Johann Straus II. Among them are Kaiser-Walzer, Op. 437, and Schatz-Walzer, Op. 418, from the operetta The Gypsy Baron. In May 1921, the likes of Arnold Schönberg, Alban Berg, and Anton Webern wrote these chamber music arrangements to raise funds for their Society for Private Musical Performances. Although both the concert and the auction of the scores were very successful, the Society eventually went under. In addition to these pieces by Strauss, The Philharmonics perform works by Fritz Kreisler, Leopold Godowsky, as well as The Philharmonics's first violinist, Tibor Kováč. The program comes to an end with Godowsky's tribute to the city: Alt Wien.

programme.title: Ballets de Monte Carlo
programme.desc: 'La Belle' (The Sleeping Beauty) is a three-act ballet by award-winning French choreographer Jean-Christophe Maillot. In 1993, Maillot became artistic director of the Ballets de Monte-Carlo, creating over 30 ballets for the company, including 'Romeo and Juliet' (1996), 'Scheherazade' (2009), and 'Opus 50' (2011). Based on Charles Perrault's famous fairy tale, Maillot staged this unconventional and unique version of 'La Belle', which explores the darker side of Perrault's story. The incredible choreography is set to the score of Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky, performed by the Monte-Carlo Philharmonic Orchestra under the baton of Nicolas Brochot. Besides the performers of the Ballets de Monte-Carlo, the production features star dancers of the Bolshoi Ballet: Semyon Chudin (Prince) and Olga Smirnova (La Belle). This performance was recorded at the Salle des Princes of the Grimaldi Forum in Monaco, in December 2016.

programme.title: Lynyrd Skynyrd
programme.desc: This film revisits the story of Lynyrd Skynyrd in a manner previously unattempted. Using a mixture of new and archive interviews, contributions from band members and those closest to the group, location shoots, news reports and a fascinating first-hand description of the fateful 1977 plane crash, this program is set to become the standard documentary work on this legendary band.

programme.desc: The Austin City Limits Music Festival is an annual music festival that takes place at Zilker Park in Austin, Texas. The festival features more than 130 bands on eight stages for three days.

programme.title: Public Enemy
programme.desc: Public Enemy, also known as PE, is an influential hip hop group from Long Island, New York, known for its politically charged lyrics, criticism of the media, and active interest in the concerns of the African American community. In 2004, Rolling Stone Magazine ranked Public Enemy number forty-four on its list of the Immortals: 100. Here, the group performs at The Metro Theatre, in Sydney, Australia, on December 27, 2008.

programme.desc: The Fillmore Auditorium is a historic concert hall in San Francisco, California. Founded by Bill Graham, it was named after being located originally on the corners of Fillmore Street and Geary Boulevard.

programme.title: Flying Over Spanish Islands
programme.desc: In their first collaboration, cinematographer Stefan Zimmerman and Nature Relaxation™ producer David Huting present "Above the Spanish Islands." This 50-minute 4K aerial film captures Mallorca and the Canary Islands, set to ambient music by Diamans, Electus, and Michael St. Laurent.

programme.title: Flying Over Iceland
programme.desc: "Flying Over Iceland: Part I" provides a soothing aerial journey through eastern Iceland's fjords and valleys, starting at sunrise in Brei_dalsvik. Enjoy views of mists, a waterfall, and the Brei_dals' river, set to nature sounds and music by The Cynic Project, showcasing East Iceland's beauty.

programme.title: Flying Over Iceland 2
programme.desc: "Flying Over Iceland II: Summer in the Golden Circle" presents a serene aerial view of Iceland's south coast, starting at Skogafoss and moving to Vik, with black sand beaches, cliffs, and Vatnajökull glacier. Filmed in 2020, this 1-hour film features local wildlife and immersive music.

programme.title: Flying Over Kauai
programme.desc: "Flying Over Kauai" provides a soothing aerial journey over Hawaii's Garden Island, featuring the lush NaPali Coast, waterfalls, canyons, and beaches. Paired with new music by The Cynic Project and nature sounds, this 4K film offers a visually and sonically immersive experience.

programme.title: Flying Over Oahu
programme.desc: "Flying Over Oahu" offers a 97-minute aerial journey over Oahu's iconic coastlines with nature sounds and music by Alex Smith (The Cynic Project). From Waikiki Beach to Turtle Bay, enjoy breathtaking 4K landscapes, ending with a stunning Waikiki sunset.

programme.title: Flying Over Fiji Islands 2
programme.desc: "Flying over Fiji Islands 2" offers a 1-hour and 42-minute journey across Fiji's majestic landscapes. Combining nature sounds with ambient music by The Cynic Project, it features smooth ground-level and aerial shots, concluding with a breathtaking real-time sunset over the sea.

programme.title: Flying Over Bermuda
programme.desc: "Flying Over Bermuda" offers an 80-minute relaxation journey above Bermuda's turquoise waters and coastlines in 4K Ultra HD. Filmed by Noel Thomas, it features sights like Horseshoe Bay and the Vixen shipwreck, with music by The Cynic Project and other artists

programme.title: Flying Over Azores
programme.desc: Escape to the Azores with this stunning 4K relaxation video showcasing drone footage of these beautiful Portuguese islands, known as the Hawaii of Europe. Enjoy a tranquil hour-long journey with exclusive music from Relax Moods, perfect for unwinding and experiencing nature's peace.

programme.title: Flying Over Big Sur
programme.desc: Soar over California's Big Sur for an hour of relaxation with "Big Sur From Above," Nature Relaxation's 2019 drone film. See iconic sites like McWay Falls and Bixby Bridge from a stunning aerial view, with soothing ambient music and nature sounds for an immersive escape

programme.title: Flying Over Fiji Islands 2
programme.desc: "Flying over Fiji Islands 2" offers a 1-hour and 42-minute journey across Fiji's majestic landscapes. Combining nature sounds with ambient music by The Cynic Project, it features smooth ground-level and aerial shots, concluding with a breathtaking real-time sunset over the sea.

programme.title: Far North Beaches: New Zealand
programme.desc: Take in the tranquil beaches of New Zealand's Far North, complete with scenery that depicts the small coves, white sand, and alternating rocky outcrop that paint this region's coastline.

programme.title: America's Beautiful West
programme.desc: Immerse yourself in the awe-inspiring, majestic sights and sounds of America's beautiful west for 1 full hour of relaxation and inspiration. Viewers will be gracefully swept from one vibrant landscape to the next, featuring iconic and hidden scenes from throughout California, Oregon, Washington, Arizona, Utah, Wyoming, and Nevada. Discover abundant wonders of Nature in some of her most dazzling displays from the old-growth forests and rocky coastlines of the Pacific Northwest, to the other-worldly rock formations and majestic waterfalls found in the Southwest, viewers will quickly discover just why America offers arguably the most beautiful & diverse natural wonders in the world. The soundtrack is complete with a dual-stereo track of ambient nature sounds filmed on-location, paired to a soothing backdrop of soothing music for total relaxation.

programme.title: Beach Paradise: East Bali
programme.desc: Relax to a serene soundtrack as you journey to spectacular beaches from Bali.

programme.title: Cape Reinga & Giant Sand Dunes: New Zealand
programme.desc: Take in the idyllic sights of giant sand dunes surrounded by a snaking river and greenery.

programme.title: Lover's island & Entalula beach
programme.desc: Get inspired by powder-white beaches and shimmering waters, in this idyllic vacation destination.

programme.title: Magical Mcway Cove
programme.desc: Enjoy the wondrous sights & sounds of one of the best coastal views in the world - Big Sur - in full 4K glory. Prepare your senses for a relaxation experience only Big Sur and 4K can offer.

programme.title: Bryce Canyon Relaxation
programme.desc: Replace your worries with the wonders of one of the world's most breathtaking natural destinations: Bryce Canyon, in Utah. Filmed in 4K UHD, this 1-hour ambient cinematic experience immerses viewers in over 20 different real-time scenes from a perfect summer day and gentle clouds passing.
